intro: Quararibea huallagensis, commonly known as the Huallangensis quilla, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
